abstract: Major technology companies are consolidating their support into the Linux Foundation to help the operating system compete more effectively against Microsoft.
snippet: Major technology companies are consolidating their support into the Linux Foundation to help the operating system compete more effectively against Microsoft.
lead_paragraph: Linux, the free operating system, has gone from an intriguing experiment to a mainstream technology in corporate data centers, helped by the backing of major technology companies like I.B.M., Intel and Hewlett-Packard, which sponsored industry consortiums to promote its adoption.

headline.main: Group Formed to Support Linux as Rival to Windows
headline.print_headline: Group Formed To Support Linux as Rival To Windows
